TopicTitle: Eagle 5 Spaceballs (AI Chat GPT Was Wrong)

Articles.Content:
Hi Everyone.

I asked Microsoft's AI GPT chat: Is it possible to build and fly Eagle 5 from the movie Space Balls in KSP2?

Answer: I'm sorry, but I don't think that's possible. KSP2 is a realistic space flight sim that requires you to design and launch rockets, spaceships and planes using realistic physics and engineering principals.

Eagle 5 is a fictional spacecraft from the comedy movie Spaceballs, which is a parody of Star Wars and other Sci-Fi franchises. It's a modified 1986 Winnebago Chieftain 33 motorhome with space engines and wings attached.

It doesn't follow any of the rules of aerodynamics or orbital mechanics that KSP2 simulates. It would probably explode on the launchpad or crash into the ground as soon as you try to fly it.

Please leave a like if you would like to see future builds

Thanks For Watching

Thrust To Weight: 1.203

Total Mass 354.46t

Dry Mass: 126.25t

Parts: 517

Height: 7.25m

Width: 23.69m

Length: 21.33m

Would recommend using unbreakable joints.

Craft Download:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eZtS7GiitZFQGulUFWA_FC6BI12KXBNm/view?usp=sharing

Edited June 7, 2023 by Madishmike

This is beautiful! I did a much, much smaller one in KSP1, but it was just a Minmus lander- it definitely could not have escaped Kerbin atmo! I love doing sci-fi replicas. I'm glad to see KSP2 opens new possibilities there.

 

Edit:

PS  Also, I live in a motorhome full-time, and am an RV enthusiast, so your Eagle 5 appeals to me there as well.
